```python
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

class PaymentProcessor(ABC):
    @abstractmethod
    def process_payment(self, amount):
        pass

class CreditCardPaymentProcessor(PaymentProcessor):
    def process_payment(self, amount):
        print(f"Processing credit card payment of ${amount}")
        print("Validating credit card information")
        print("Charging credit card")
        print("Recording the credit card transaction")

class PayPalPaymentProcessor(PaymentProcessor):
    def process_payment(self, amount):
        print(f"Processing PayPal payment of ${amount}")
        print("Redirecting user to PayPal")
        print("Confirming PayPal payment")
        print("Recording the PayPal transaction")

class BankTransferPaymentProcessor(PaymentProcessor):
    def process_payment(self, amount):
        print(f"Processing bank transfer of ${amount}")
        print("Generating bank transfer instructions")
        print("Sending transfer confirmation email")
        print("Recording the bank transfer transaction")
```

In this refactored code, we have created an abstract base class PaymentProcessor with an abstract method process_payment. We then create concrete classes for each payment type that inherit from PaymentProcessor and implement the process_payment method. This way, if we want to add a new payment type in future, we just need to create a new class that inherits from PaymentProcessor and implements the process_payment method. The PaymentProcessor class no longer depends on concrete implementations of payment methods which adheres to Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP).

```python
class Content:
    def __init__(self, text, type, metadata):
        self.text = text
        self.type = type
        self.metadata = metadata
    
    def get_text(self):
        return self.text
    
    def get_type(self):
        return self.type
    
    def get_metadata(self):
        return self.metadata

class ContentFilter:
    def filter_content(self, content):
        filtered_text = content.get_text()
        
        if content.get_type() == "email":
            filtered_text = self.filter_email_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
            
        elif content.get_type() == "social":
            filtered_text = self.filter_social_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
            
        elif content.get_type() == "comment":
            filtered_text = self.filter_comment_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
        
        filtered_text = self.remove_common_profanity(filtered_text)
        filtered_text = self.remove_personal_info(filtered_text)
        
        return filtered_text
    
    def filter_email_content(self, text, metadata):
        audience = metadata.get("audience", "general")
        
        if audience == "public":
            import re
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)confidential:', '[REDACTED]', text)
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)internal use only', '[INTERNAL]', text)
        
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)from:\s.*?\n', '', text)
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)to:\s.*?\n', '', text)
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)cc:\s.*?\n', '', text)
        
        return text
    
    def filter_social_content(self, text, metadata):
        platform = metadata.get("platform", "general")
        audience = metadata.get("audience", "general")
        
        import re
        if platform == "twitter":
            text = re.sub(r'@([A-Za-z0-9_]+)', '[USERNAME]', text)
        elif platform == "facebook":
            text = re.sub(r'@\[[^\]]+\]', '[NAME]', text)
        
        if audience == "minor":
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)alcohol|beer|wine', '[AGE-RESTRICTED]', text)
        
        return text
    
    def filter_comment_content(self, text, metadata):
        context = metadata.get("context", "general")
        
        import re
        if context == "news":
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)allegedly|reportedly', '[STATEMENT]', text)
        elif context == "review":
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)terrible|awful|worst ever', 'not satisfactory', text)
        
        return text
    
    def remove_common_profanity(self, text):
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)badword1|badword2|badword3', '[INAPPROPRIATE]', text)
        return text
    
    def remove_personal_info(self, text):
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'\d{3}-\d{2}-\d{4}', '[SSN]', text)
        text = re.sub(r'\d{16}', '[CREDIT_CARD]', text)
        return text
```

```python
        filtered_text = content.get_text()
        
        if content.get_type() == "email":
            filtered_text = self.filter_email_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
            
        elif content.get_type() == "social":
            filtered_text = self.filter_social_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
            
        elif content.get_type() == "comment":
            filtered_text = self.filter_comment_content(filtered_text, content.get_metadata())
        
        filtered_text = self.remove_common_profanity(filtered_text)
        filtered_text = self.remove_personal_info(filtered_text)
        
        return filtered_text
    
    def filter_email_content(self, text, metadata):
        audience = metadata.get("audience", "general")
        
        if audience == "public":
            import re
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)confidential:', '[REDACTED]', text)
            text = re.sub(r'(?i)internal use only', '[INTERNAL]', text)
        
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)from:\s.*?\n', '', text)
        text = re.sub(r'(?i)to:\s.*?\n', '', text)
        return text

        import re
        text = re.sub(r'@[a-z0-9_]+', '@USER', text)
        return text
    
    def filter_comment_content(self, text, metadata):
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'\b(fuck|shit|damn)\b', '[CENSORED]', text)
        return text
    
    def remove_common_profanity(self, text):
        import re
        text = re.sub(r'\b(bad|worse|ugly)\b', '[BLEEP]', text)
        return text
    
    def remove_personal_info(self, text):
        import re
```
